intro: Potentilla drummondii subsp. bruceae, commonly known as Drummond's cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its bright yellow flowers and compound leaves. The species belongs to the Rosaceae family and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It typically thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
